com.bretth.osmosis.core.pipeline.common
Class TaskManagerFactory

java.lang.Object
  com.bretth.osmosis.core.pipeline.common.TaskManagerFactory
Direct Known Subclasses:
AreaFilterTaskManagerFactory, ChangeApplierFactory, ChangeBufferFactory, ChangeDeriverFactory, ChangeMergerFactory, ChangeProgressLoggerFactory, ChangeSorterFactory, ChangeTeeFactory, DatabaseTaskManagerFactory, EntityBufferFactory, EntityMergerFactory, EntityProgressLoggerFactory, EntityReporterFactory, EntitySorterFactory, EntityTeeFactory, IntegrityReporterFactory, NullChangeWriterFactory, NullWriterFactory, PostgreSqlDumpWriterFactory, XmlDownloaderFactory, XmlTaskManagerFactory
public abstract class TaskManagerFactory
extends java.lang.Object

All task implementations require a corresponding task manager factory. This task manager factory is responsible for instantiating a task based upon command line arguments, and instantiating a task manager to manage the task within a pipeline. The factories are singleton instances registered globally and re-used for every task to be created.

Author:
Brett Henderson
